description.en: This course provides an advanced-level approach to the scientific principles, methodologies, formulation, processing, applications, recent trends, and emerging technologies in the research of nanoparticulate drug delivery systems. The course will provide an insight into (but not limited) parenteral, oral, topical, pulmonary, ocular nanotechnology-based drug delivery systems and their therapeutic uses, biological requirements for nano-therapeutic applications, the role of nano-biotechnology in the development of nanomedicine, and recent advances and future perspectives in pharmaceutical nanoparticulate technology.
description.et:
See kursus on mõeldud täiendavaks teadmiste omandamiseks nanoosaksestest valmistatud ravimite kandursüsteemide disainimise teaduslike printsiipide, meetodite, disaini, tootmise, kasutamise kohta. Tutvustatakse olemasolevaid ja arendatavaid tehnoloogiaid.
Kursuse käigus tutvutakse parenteraalsele, suukaudsete, lokaalsete, inhaleeritavate ja silma manustatavate (ja mitte ainult) nanotehnoloogial baseeruvate ravimite kandursüsteemidega ja nende kasutamisvõimalustega, neile esitatavate nõuete, nanobiotehnoloogial põhinevate ravimite hetkeseisu ja tulevikuperspektiividega.

objectives.en: The course aims to provide an advanced level of knowledge on the scientific methodologies, formulation, processing, applications, recent trends, and emerging technologies in the research of nanoparticulate drug delivery systems. The course presents a wide range of nanotechnology-based drug delivery systems and therapeutic uses, biological requirements for nanotherapeutic applications, the role of nanobiotechnology in the development of nanomedicine, and recent advances and future perspectives in pharmaceutical nanoparticulate technology.
objectives.et:
Kursus annab ülevaate nanoosaksetel põhinevate ravimite kandursüsteemide uurimise teaduslikest meetoditest, nende disainimise ja tootmise hetkeseisust ning tulevikusuundadest.
Kursusel tutvustatakse nanotehnoloogial põhinevaid ravimite kandursüsteeme ja terapeutilisi lähenemisi, neile esitatavaid bioloogilisi nõudeid. Räägitakse nanobiotehnoloogia kohast nanoravimite arendamisel ja farmatseutilise nanotehnoloogia arengust.

learning_outcomes.en: The MSc/PhD student who has passed the course:
-	knows the classification and types of nanoparticulate drug delivery systems
learning_outcomes.et: - teab ravimite kandursüsteemide klassifikatsiooni ja nanoosakeste tüüpe;

learning_outcomes.en: -	have an overview on the different therapeutic applications and route of administration of nanoparticulate drug delivery systems (including gene delivery and vaccination)
learning_outcomes.et: - omab ülevaadet erinevatest nano	süsteemidest, nende manustamisviisidest ja kasutamisest (kaasa arvatud geeniteraapia ja vaktsineerimine);

learning_outcomes.en: -	knows the materials, technologies and challenges related to the formulation and characterization of nanoparticulate drug delivery systems
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab nanosüsteeme iseloomustada, tunneb kasutatavaid materjale, tehnoloogiaid ning nende valmistamisega seotud probleeme;

learning_outcomes.en: -	knows the biological requirements for nano therapeutic applications
learning_outcomes.et: - teab nanoterapeutiliste vahendite kasutamise bioloogilisi nõudeid;

learning_outcomes.en: -	knows the nanotoxicity and regulatory aspects related to the nanoparticulate drug delivery systems
learning_outcomes.et: - teab nanosüsteemidega seotud nanotoksilisusest ja regulatoorsetest aspektidest;

learning_outcomes.en: -	understand the added value of any developed nanoparticulate drug delivery system (intellectual property aspects).
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab arendatud nanosüsteemidega seotud intellektuaalse omandi küsimusi.

independent_work.et:
Regular subject. Lectures, seminars, scientific article reviews .
In the seminar session (xx.xx.), 15-20 min student presentations based on research articles in Pharmaceutical nanotechnology.

grade_evaluation.et:
eksam (A,B,C,D,E,F).
Final exam (A,B,C,D,E,F)
There is a written examination in the end of the course. Completing the learning assignments is required for passing the course


A - Excellent (91-100%):	The student shows an excellent knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers are exceptionally well and precisely compiled, logically presented, and correct. The language is also perfect.   

B - Very good (81-90%):	The student shows very good knowledge on the course 
topic area and substance. The anwers are well written  and mainly correct. The language is also good without any significant flaws.   
 
C - Good (71-80%): 	The student shows a good knowledge on the course  topic area and substance. The anwers are quite well compiled and mainly correct. The language is also quite good with only some flaws.   

D - Satisfactory (61-70%):	The student shows satisfactory knowledge on the  course topic area and substance. The anwers contain  some siginificant deficiences and flaws. The language is only fair to passable with clear mistakes.   

E - Passable (51-60%): 	The student shows only a fair and passable knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers contain many deficiences. The language is quite poor with numerous flaws.   

F - Rejected (0-50%): 	The student shows very poor knowledge on the course topic area and substance. The anwers contain numerous significant flaws and deficiences. The language is very poor with numerous flaws.

resources.mandatory_materials:
- D. Thassu, M. Deleers, Y. V. Pathak (eds.),
Nanoparticulate Drug Delivery Systems, CRC Press, Taylor & Francis Group, Informa Healthcare, New York, 376 p. (the latest edition)
- I.F. Uchegbu, A.G. Schätzlein, W.P. Cheng, A. Lalatsa (Eds.): Fundamentals of Pharmaceutical Nanoscience, Springer, New York, USA (2013 or the latest edition).

description.et:
Opening remarks (J.H.)
Introduction to Nanoscience and Pharmaceutical nanotechnology
Nanotechnology-based drug delivery systems  (NDDSs) (overview)		
Delivery of seminar topics and materials

Pharmaceutical development and fabrication of NDDSs (part I) (J.H.)
- Nanoparticles/crystals, nanocapsules
- Nanosuspensions, nanoemulsions, nanogels

Pharmaceutical development and fabrication of NDDSs (part II) (J.H.)
- Liposomes
- Micelles, filomicelles, niosomes, ethosomes
- Polymersomes
- Dendrimers

Pharmaceutical development and preparation of NDDSs (part III) (J.H.)
- Nanofibers and platforms (nanomats)
- Biomedical uses of nanomats

Organelle-specific aspects in Pharmaceutical nanotechnology (J.H.)
- Subcellular nanomedicine
- Nanosensors and intracellular environment
- Uptake and subcellular/intracellular fate of nanodelivery systems
- Cellular interactions of nanodelivery systems
Medical applications of fullerenes & carbon nanotubes (A.L.)

Regulatory issues of nanotechnology
Nanotechnology product development & commercialization
Toxicology assessment of NDDSs

Final seminar (student presentations & discussion)

audience.et: doktorandid (Doctorete studies), Proviisoriõpe 4, Proviisoriõpe 5, Arstiteadus 3-6, Hambaarstiteadus 3-5
